meanings.sent1: The park was full of happy wallowers enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The wallowers gathered by the river to watch the ducks swim by.
meanings.sent3: The wallowers giggled as they rolled down the grassy hill.
meanings.sent4: The wallowers in the mud seemed to blend in with the earth itself.
meanings.sent5: The wallowers' laughter echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The wallowers in the field were hard at work planting seeds.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of wallowers carrying heavy buckets of water.
meanings.sent3: The wallowers cheered as they completed their task ahead of time.
meanings.sent4: The wallowers moved in unison, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The wallowers' teamwork was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: Those who indulge in self-pity or self-indulgence.
meanings.sent1: The wallowers in the corner of the room seemed lost in their own thoughts.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the company of wallowers who always complained.
meanings.sent3: The wallowers sighed dramatically when they didn't get their way.
meanings.sent4: The wallowers' self-pity was like a dark cloud hanging over the group.
meanings.sent5: The wallowers' constant complaints grated on everyone's nerves.
